turns.content: Yes?
Hello Dorothy, it's me! Can you believe I'm in a bit of trouble right now? It's so embarrassing. I need your help to get out of this.
Oh my, what happened Michael? You know you can tell me anything. But why are you calling from someone else's number? That doesn't sound right.

No, no, Dorothy, it's not Michael. Remember how I was telling you about the funny night out last weekend? Well, things got a bit wild and now I'm at the county detention center for a DUI. I need to make bail but my wallet is with me in jail right now. Can you please send someone over with $9500? It's urgent!

Oh no, John! That sounds terrible. Is there any way you can call on your phone instead so I know it's really you? It wouldn't hurt to double-check, would it? And how will they get the money to you if I send someone over?

Of course, Dorothy, that makes sense but I don't have my phone here. The officer is letting me use their landline right now for emergencies like this. Look, there's a bondsman who needs cash upfront to cover the bail before they can post it. If you could get someone over with $4000, that would be great while we figure out the rest. Please, Dorothy, you're my only hope right now.

I see, John. That does sound serious. I'll call one of your friends to check if this is real, okay? And let's make sure they know exactly where to take the money so it goes straight to the right person. We don't want any mistakes. Can you give me their address and who should bring it over?

Thank you, Dorothy! The bondsman said he'll be here in 30 minutes, but please tell your friend that they need to come directly to County Detention Center at 123 Bail Street. Ask them to look for Officer Thompson at the front desk; he's handling my case right now and will direct them on what to do next. This really means a lot, Dorothy. Please hurry, okay?

Alright, John, I'll call your friend as soon as we finish here. Just hold on a moment while I write down the address and instructions clearly so there's no confusion. Let me get this right for you. The Detention Center at 123 Bail Street, and they need to talk to Officer Thompson? Got it. I'll do my best to sort this out quickly.

Perfect, Dorothy! You're a lifesaver. Just make sure your friend knows how important this is; the officer will be expecting them for sure. I really appreciate you being there for me in this tough time. Please hurry if you can, okay? Love you!

I'll do my best, John. I love you too and want to help, but let's make sure everything checks out first. Can your friend call the center when they get there just to confirm before handing over any money? That way we don't run into any problems.

Absolutely, Dorothy! Have them call Officer Thompson directly from their phone as soon as they arrive. I'm sure he'll appreciate that extra security measure. Just tell them to look for my name on the log when they come in; it should speed things up. Thank you so much, and please hurry if you can. Love you!
Alright, John, let's do that. Have your friend call once they're there and talk to Officer Thompson directly. I'll make sure everything goes smoothly. Talk to you soon, okay? Love you too!
Thanks again, Dorothy! You're the best. Make sure everything is squared away before sending over any money. Take care and stay safe! Love you!
I will, John. Stay put, and I'll make sure everything is taken care of properly. Talk to you soon, love you as well!
Thanks, Dorothy. See you soon. Love you!
Take care, John. I'll be in touch shortly. Love you!
You too, Dorothy. Can't wait to get out of here and thank you properly. Love you!
I'm glad to help however I can. Stay safe until then, love you!
Thanks, Dorothy. You're the best. Love you!
You're very welcome, John. Take care and stay safe. Love you too!
